HOSTAGE.Definition: someone who is held or taken as security that specified conditions will be met before their release

NEGOTIATIONS.Definition: discussions in order to reach an agreement

NEGOTIATE.Definition: discuss the terms or conditions of hostage release

NERVE-WRACKING.Definition: causing a lot of worry and anxiety

FOLLOW THROUGH.Definition: do what needs to be done until the end

HOSTAGE-TAKER.Definition: the one responsible for holding someone as security that specified conditions will be met before their release

PERPETRATORS.Definition: people who have done the illegal or criminal acts

NEGOTIATOR.Definition: the one who talks with them in order to reach an agreement

TONE.Definition: a quality in the voice expressing a particular feeling or thought

RESOLUTION.Definition: answer or end to the problem

RESOLUTIONS.Definition: answers or ends to the problem

RESORT TO.Definition: do it as a final solution

PRIVATE CHARTER PLANE.Definition: an aeroplane that is used for private flights that are not part of a regular airline route

TARMAC.Definition: material used for covering roads, airport runways etc.

ASSURED.Definition: told in a convincing way in order to remove doubt

FLOTATION GEAR.Definition: emergency gear used in case of a forced landing on water

STANDOFF.Definition: a situation in which agreement didn't seem possible

ACCOMPLICE.Definition: a person who helped him to commit the crime

TYRES.Definition: thick rubber rings that surround the wheels

HIJACKING.Definition: taking control of the aircraft illegally

NEGOTIATION.Definition: discussion in order to reach an agreement

RIGID.Definition: fixed, not able to be changed

IN HINDSIGHT.Definition: considering it after it has happened

TURBULENT.Definition: involving a lot of difficulty and arguments

RECRUIT.Definition: find people to become members of their organisations

DISPLACEMENT.Definition: the situation in which they were forced to leave their places

REFUGEES.Definition: people who had left their countries because of the war

INFILTRATED.Definition: entered it in order to get information

WRESTLER.Definition: a person who took part in the sport of wrestling

GLIMPSED.Definition: saw for a short time or briefly

HE WAS NO MATCH FOR.Definition: he was unable to compete successfully with

TRANSFIXED ON.Definition: unable to move because of their great interest in it

HOSTAGES.Definition: people who were held or taken as security that specified conditions will be met before their release

CHECKPOINTS.Definition: spots where security checks would be made

SIEGE.Definition: the surrounding of the place by armed forces

NEGOTIATORS.Definition: the people who would talk with them in order to reach an agreement

BLAMING.Definition: say that they are responsible for it

BEG.Definition: ask them in a desperate or urgent way

AIRSTRIP.Definition: the long, flat piece of land which aeroplanes use to take off or land

MEDIA BLACKOUT.Definition: a situation when news about the event was not allowed to be reported

SNIPERS.Definition: people expert at shooting from a long distance

BULLETPROOF VESTS.Definition: protective coverings to protect them against bullets

INFRARED.Definition: using technology that would allow them to see them in the dark

TELESCOPIC SIGHTS.Definition: devices that would allow them to see distant targets

TRAP.Definition: a situation in which the authorities had planned to attack them

CRAWL.Definition: move slowly on his hands and knees

FIREFIGHT.Definition: a fight in which guns were used

ANXIOUSLY.Definition: in a very worried or nervous way

AIRFIELD.Definition: the area where the aeroplanes take off and land

HINDSIGHT.Definition: understanding the situation only after it has happened
